intro: Conostylis aculeata subsp. aculeata, commonly known as the prickly conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellow or white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid and semi-arid regions. The subspecies is distinguished by its sharp, prickly leaves and robust growth habit.
